cards.name: Pansage
cards.text: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Simisage
cards.text: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

attacks.name: Fire's Power
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Sewaddle
cards.text: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Sewaddle
cards.text: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

cards.name: Swadloon
cards.text: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

attacks.name: Double Razor Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Swadloon
cards.text: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

attacks.name: Grass Cocooning
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Leavanny
cards.text: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.

attacks.name: Nurturing
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Leavanny
cards.text: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

attacks.name: Triple Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Cottonee
cards.text: They go wherever the wind takes them. On rainy days, their bodies are heavier, so they take shelter beneath big trees.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Cottonee
cards.text: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Whimsicott
cards.text: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

attacks.name: Helping Hand
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Whimsicott
cards.text: Riding whirlwinds, they appear. These Pokémon sneak through gaps into houses and cause all sorts of mischief.

attacks.name: Encore
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can only use that attack.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Petilil
cards.text: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Lilligant
cards.text: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

attacks.name: Bemusing Aroma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Deerling
cards.text: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Sawsbuck
cards.text: The plants growing on its horns change according to the season. The leaders of the herd possess magnificent horns.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Virizion
cards.text: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sacred Sword
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Sacred Sword during your next turn.

cards.name: Pansear
cards.text: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600º F.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Simisear
cards.text: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

attacks.name: Water's Power
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Darumaka
cards.text: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.

cards.name: Darmanitan
cards.text: Its internal fire burns at 2,500º F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Fire Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Panpour
cards.text: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Simipour
cards.text: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.

attacks.name: Grass' Power
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached to it, heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rushing Water
attacks.text: Move an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Basculin
cards.text: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they'll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Final Gambit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this Pokémon does 80 damage to itself.

cards.name: Basculin
cards.text: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Ducklett
cards.text: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

attacks.name: Roost
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

cards.name: Swanna
cards.text: It administers sharp, powerful pecks with its bill. It whips its long neck to deliver forceful repeated strikes.

attacks.name: Wing Dance
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Cubchoo
cards.text: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Cubchoo
cards.text: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

cards.name: Beartic
cards.text: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Icicle Crash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Beartic
cards.text: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Emolga
cards.text: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membranes and released while it is gliding.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Joltik
cards.text: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.

cards.name: Galvantula
cards.text: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Thundurus
cards.text: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Disaster Volt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Woobat
cards.text: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Swoobat
cards.text: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

attacks.name: Phat Sound
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Venipede
cards.text: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Whirlipede
cards.text: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Steamroller
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Scolipede
cards.text: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

attacks.name: Toxic Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Wild Horn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Sigilyph
cards.text: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.

attacks.name: Reflect
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Sigilyph
cards.text: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Psychic Assault
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Gothita
cards.text: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Gothita
cards.text: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

cards.name: Gothorita
cards.text: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Gothorita
cards.text: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

attacks.name: Deleting Glare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Gothitelle

abilities.name: Magic Room
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.

cards.text: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

attacks.name: Madkinesis
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Gothitelle
cards.text: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.

attacks.name: Mental Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Roggenrola
cards.text: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 40 or less.

cards.name: Roggenrola
cards.text: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Boldore
cards.text: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.

attacks.name: Smack Down
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Fighting Resistance, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Boldore
cards.text: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.

attacks.name: Hard Crash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Gigalith
cards.text: The solar energy absorbed by its body's orange crystals is magnified internally and fired from its mouth.

attacks.name: Shear
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Fighting Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Bullet
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Drilbur
cards.text: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.

attacks.name: Hone Claws
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Drilbur
cards.text: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

cards.name: Excadrill
cards.text: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

attacks.name: Drill Run
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Excadrill
cards.text: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Throh
cards.text: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.

attacks.name: Scarf Hold
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Sawk
cards.text: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

attacks.name: Five Fierce Chops
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Sandile
cards.text: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

cards.name: Krokorok
cards.text: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Krookodile

abilities.name: Black Eyes
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.text: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Terrakion
cards.text: This Pokémon came to the defense of Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.

attacks.name: Sacred Sword
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Sacred Sword during your next turn.

cards.name: Purrloin
cards.text: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Liepard
cards.text: These Pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Zorua
cards.text: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Zoroark
cards.text: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Vullaby
cards.text: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rear Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Mandibuzz
cards.text: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Ferroseed
cards.text: They stick their spikes into cave walls and absorb the minerals they find in the rock.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Ferroseed
cards.text: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

cards.name: Ferrothorn
cards.text: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

attacks.name: Steel Feelers
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Ferrothorn
cards.text: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Power Whip
attacks.text: Does 10 damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Klink
cards.text: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.

attacks.name: Gear Grind
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Klang
cards.text: Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don't return.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Klinklang
cards.text: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

cards.name: Cobalion
cards.text: This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.

attacks.name: Metal Horns
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sacred Sword
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Sacred Sword during your next turn.

cards.name: Patrat
cards.text: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Watchog
cards.text: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

attacks.name: Watcheck
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back on top of his or her deck in any order.

attacks.name: Quick Tail Smash
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Pidove
cards.text: Each follows its Trainer's orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

cards.name: Tranquill
cards.text: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Unfezant
cards.text: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves fell close to anyone other than their Trainers.

attacks.name: Tailwind
attacks.text: Attach an Energy from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Feather Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Audino
cards.text: Its auditory sense is astounding. It has a radar-like ability to understand its surrounding through slight sounds.

attacks.name: Powerful Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Heal Pulse
attacks.text: Heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Minccino
cards.text: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

attacks.name: Last Resort
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Cinccino
cards.text: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.

attacks.name: Captivate
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fluffy Tail
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Rufflet
cards.text: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

cards.name: Rufflet
cards.text: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Braviary
cards.text: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Tornadus
cards.text: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

attacks.name: Energy Wheel
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Bianca
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Cheren
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Crushing Hammer
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Great Ball
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Max Potion
cards.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. Then, discard all Energy attached to that Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Catcher
cards.text: Switch your opponent's Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Recycle
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Thundurus
cards.text: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Disaster Volt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Tornadus
cards.text: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

attacks.name: Energy Wheel
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
